title: Viet Nam: "5 in 1" vaccine to be tested after three infant deaths
author: Tfu
description: The Ministry of Health on 20 December 2012 asked the World Health Organization (WHO) and the manufacturer to verify the safety of the Quinvaxem and polio vaccines, after three babies in Nghe An pro...
cleaned_text: The Ministry of Health on 20 December 2012 asked the World Health Organization (WHO) and the manufacturer to verify the safety of the Quinvaxem and polio vaccines, after three babies in Nghe An province died after vaccination. The Preventive Medicine Agency has directed the National Institute of Hygiene and Epidemiology, the National Children's Hospital in collaboration with the Nghe An Department of Health, to investigate the three deaths. Nghe An has also stopped using the batches of Quinvaxem vaccine and polio vaccine which were injected into the three children, and sent vaccine samples to the National Institute for Vaccine and Medical Products Inspection to test. According to the Preventive Medicine Agency, there is no evidence of the relevance of vaccines and immunization services to these deaths. The storage and transportation of the vaccines observed the regulations. The immunization staff was trained in accordance with the rules. On 7 December 2012, two three-month-old babies in Chau Quang commune, Quy Hop district, Nghe An province, were vaccinated with Quinvaxem vaccine dose one, and took oral polio vaccine for the first time at the local health station. One of them died 34 hours after vaccination, showing nothing unusual. The remaining baby had fever in the evening, reduced fever in the next day. On 10 December 2012 (66 hours after the injection), the baby died. The third baby was injected with the vaccine on 10 December 2012, in Dong Hop commune, and died on 12 December 2012 (38 hours after the injection). There are two types of "5 in 1" vaccines. One is called Quinvaxem, from South Korea, preventing at the same time five diseases including diphtheria, pertussis, tetanus, Haemophilus influenzae type B (Hib), and hepatitis B. This is the vaccine used in the expanded program on immunization. The second type is the Pentaxim vaccine from France, to prevent diphtheria, pertussis, tetanus, polio, and Hib.
